Variable Flip Angle¶

class Models.T1_Mapping.VFA_T1¶

Compute a T1 map using Variable Flip Angle

————-USAGE————
See for an example
————-ASSUMPTIONS—————–
—————INPUTS————–
  1. SPGR : spoiled Gradient echo data, 4D volume with different flip angles
  2. B1map : excitation (B1+) fieldmap. Used to correct flip angles.
————-OUTPUTS—————–
Fitting Parameters
  • T1 : Longitudinal relaxation time
  • M0 : Equilibrium magnetization
————OPTIONS—————–
None
————–PROTOCOL—————–
  • FA : list of flip angles (degrees)
  • TR : Repetition time of the whole sequence (s)
—————REFERENCE—————

Please cite the following if you use this module:

Cabana J-F, Gu Y, Boudreau M, Levesque IR, Atchia Y, Sled JG, Narayanan S, Arnold DL, Pike GB, Cohen-Adad J, Duval T, Vuong M-T and Stikov N. (2016), Quantitative magnetization transfer imaging made easy with qMTLab: Software for data simulation, analysis, and visualization. Concepts Magn. Reson.. doi: 10.1002/cmr.a.21357

Written by: Ian Gagnon, 2017

———————————-_————————————

fit(data)¶

T1 and M0

MRIinputs = u"{'SPGR','B1map'}"¶

None

Prot = u"struct('SPGR',struct('Format',{{'Flip Angle' 'TR'}},\n'Mat', [4 0.025; 10 0.025; 20 0.025]))"¶

You can define a default protocol here.
